content.description:
Complete a full 360 traverse of the boulder, either clockwise or counter-clockwise. All holds are in. Very fun and can end up being surprisingly pumpy!



Pick any location on the boulder and complete a 360 degree traverse.Â 

None

Located just off Main street and adjacent to Nat Bailey stadium, this surprisingly good and enjoyable artificial boulder has the potential for tons of great routes by selecting and eliminating certain holds.

Local climbing legend, Tami Knight, helped design the boulder in 2002, which is comprised mostly of nice textured concrete and the occasional plastic hold.

The boulder dries fairly quickly after rain, however some of the big jugs will keep a small pool of water inside. Pads are not really required because of the soft dirt/mulch mix around the base, however it loves to stick to the bottom of climbing shoes, so a pad is recommended, even as just a way to keep your shoes clean.
